availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. McWhorter (Taylor County, KY, sheriff and entrepreneur)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, sheriff and entrepreneur. Casey County, Kentucky, native. Son of William T. McWhorter and Mary E. McWhorter. Married to Mary A. Douglass McWhorter in Taylor County on November 17, 1852. Sheriff of Taylor County in 1863. Auctioneer in the firm of Cowhead & McWhorter Co. with Thomas E. Cowhead in Taylor County in 1863 and in 1865. Partner in a confectionery in Taylor County with Samuel Morton in August 1864. Carriage maker in Campbellsville, Kentucky, in 1865.
